snippet: Yale tracks Rhode Island Americana furniture; researching the decorative artist Mary Tillinghast; and artworks from the Byrdcliffe colony in Woodstock, N.Y.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; Yale University Art Gallery has a growing Web site dedicated to tracking furniture made in Rhode Island before 1800; Kent Watkins plans to self-publish a book about stained-glass artist Mary Tillinghast who died in 1912; D Wigmore Fine Art gallery displays works made at Byrdcliffe, a utopian artists' colony active in the early 20th century.
lead_paragraph: Yale tracks Rhode Island Americana furniture; researching the decorative artist Mary Tillinghast; and artworks from the Byrdcliffe colony in Woodstock, N.Y.

headline.seo: Rhode Island Americana, Mary Tillinghast and Byrdcliffe Art
